resources.name: Move by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.move }}/( name or id )

Moves are the skills of Pokémon in battle. In battle, a Pokémon uses one move each turn. Some moves (including those learned by Hidden Machine) can be used outside of battle as well, usually for the purpose of removing obstacles or exploring new areas.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#moves).

resources.name: PokéAPI Collection
resources.description:
## PokéAPI Collection

> A PokéAPI Collection for testing the endpoints

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentatio](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2) for grater detail.

resources.name: List Moves
resources.description:
> {{ _.move }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text
offset: The first Move that you will get.
limit: How many Moves per page
```

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Move Ailment by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.moveAilment }}/( name or id )

Move Ailments are status conditions caused by moves used during battle. See [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Status_condition) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#move-ailments).

resources.name: List Move Ailments
resources.description:
> {{ _.moveAilment }}/?offset=0&limit=20

```text
limit: How many Move Ailments per page
```

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Move Battle Style by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.moveBattleStyle }}/( name or id )

Styles of moves when used in the Battle Palace. See [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Battle_Frontier_(Generation_III)) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#move-battle-styles).

resources.description:
> {{ _.moveCategory }}/( name or id )

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#move-categories).

resources.name: Move Target by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.moveTarget }}/( name or id )

Targets moves can be directed at during battle. Targets can be Pokémon, environments or even other moves.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#move-targets).

resources.name: Machine by ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.machine }}/( id )

Machines are the representation of items that teach moves to Pokémon. They vary from version to version, so it is not certain that one specific TM or HM corresponds to a single Machine.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#machines).

resources.name: List Machines
resources.description:

resources.name: Location by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.location }}/( name or id )

Locations that can be visited within the games. Locations make up sizable portions of regions, like cities or routes.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#locations-section).

resources.description:

resources.name: Location Area by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.locationArea }}/( name or id )

Location areas are sections of areas, such as floors in a building or cave. Each area has its own set of possible Pokémon encounters.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#location-areas).

resources.name: Pal Park Area by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.palParkArea }}( name or id )

Areas used for grouping Pokémon encounters in Pal Park. They're like habitats that are specific to [Pal Park](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Pal_Park).

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pal-park-areas).

resources.name: Region by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.region }}/( name or id )

A region is an organized area of the Pokémon world. Most often, the main difference between regions is the species of Pokémon that can be encountered within them.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#regions).

resources.name: Item by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.item }}/( name or id )

An item is an object in the games which the player can pick up, keep in their bag, and use in some manner. They have various uses, including healing, powering up, helping catch Pokémon, or to access a new area.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#item).

resources.name: List Items
resources.description:
> {{ _.item }}/?offset=0&limit=20


Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Item Attribute by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.itemAttribute }}/( name or id )

Item attributes define particular aspects of items, e.g. "usable in battle" or "consumable".

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#item-attributes).

resources.name: Item Category
resources.description:
> {{ _.itemCategory }}/( name or id )

Item categories determine where items will be placed in the players bag.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#item-categories).

resources.name: Item Fling Effect by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.itemFlingEffect }}/( name or id )

The various effects of the move "Fling" when used with different items.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#item-fling-effects).

resources.name: Item Pocket by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.itemPocket }}/( name or id )

Pockets within the players bag used for storing items by category.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#item-pockets).

resources.name: Generation by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.generation }}/( name or id )

A generation is a grouping of the Pokémon games that separates them based on the Pokémon they include. In each generation, a new set of Pokémon, Moves, Abilities and Types that did not exist in the previous generation are released.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#generations).

resources.description:

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. ```text


resources.name: Pokedex by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokedex }}/( name or id )

A Pokédex is a handheld electronic encyclopedia device; one which is capable of recording and retaining information of the various Pokémon in a given region with the exception of the national dex and some smaller dexes related to portions of a region. See [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Pokedex) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pokedexes).

resources.description:
> {{ _.version }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

resources.description:
> {{ _.version }}/( name or id )

Versions of the games, e.g., Red, Blue or Yellow.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#version).

resources.name: Version Group by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.versionGroup }}/( name or id )

Version groups categorize highly similar versions of the games.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#version-groups).

resources.description:

resources.name: Evolution Chain by ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.evolutionChain }}/( id )

Evolution chains are essentially family trees. They start with the lowest stage within a family and detail evolution conditions for each as well as Pokémon they can evolve into up through the hierarchy.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#evolution-chains).

resources.name: Evolution Trigger by ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.evolutionTrigger }}/( id )

Evolution triggers are the events and conditions that cause a Pokémon to evolve. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Methods_of_evolution) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#evolution-triggers).

resources.description:

resources.name: Encounter Condition Value by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.encouterConditionValue }}/( name or id )

Encounter condition values are the various states that an encounter condition can have, i.e., time of day can be either day or night.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#encounter-condition-values).

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#encounter-conditions).

resources.name: Encounter Method by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.encouterMethod }}/( name or id )

Methods by which the player might can encounter Pokémon in the wild, e.g., walking in tall grass. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Wild_Pok%C3%A9mon) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#encounters-section).

resources.description:
> {{ _.superContestEffect }}/( id )

Super contest effects refer to the effects of moves when used in super contests.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#super-contest-effects).

> {{ _.contestEffect }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text
offset: The first Contest Effect that you will get.
limit: How many Contest Effects per page
```

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Contest Type by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.ContestType }}/( name or id )

Contest types are categories judges used to weigh a Pokémon's condition in Pokémon contests. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Contest_condition) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#contest-types).

resources.name: Berry Flavor by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.berryFlavor }}/( name or id )

Flavors determine whether a Pokémon will benefit or suffer from eating a berry based on their [nature](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#natures). Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Flavor) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#berry-flavors).

resources.name: Berry Firmness by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.berryFirmness }}/( name or id )

Berries can be soft or hard. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Category:Berries_by_firmness) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#berry-firmnesses).

resources.name: Berry by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.berry }}/( name or id )

Berries are small fruits that can provide HP and status condition restoration, stat enhancement, and even damage negation when eaten by Pokémon. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Berry) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#berries).

resources.name: List Abilities
resources.description:
> {{ _.ability }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

```text
limit: How many Abilities per page
```

resources.name: Ability by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.ability }}/(*name or id*)

Abilities provide passive effects for Pokémon in battle or in the overworld. Pokémon have multiple possible abilities but can have only one ability at a time. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Ability) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#abilities).

resources.name: List Characteristics
resources.description:
> {{ _.characteristic }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text
offset: The first Characteristic that you will get.
limit: How many Characteristics per page
```

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Characteristic by ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.characteristic }}/( id )

Characteristics indicate which stat contains a Pokémon's highest IV. A Pokémon's Characteristic is determined by the remainder of its highest IV divided by 5 (gene_modulo). Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Characteristic) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#characteristics).

resources.name: List Egg Groups
resources.description:
> {{ _.eggGroup }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. ```

resources.name: Egg Group by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.eggGroup }}/( name or id )

Egg Groups are categories which determine which Pokémon are able to interbreed. Pokémon may belong to either one or two Egg Groups. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Egg_Group) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#egg-groups).

resources.name: Gender by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.gender }}/( name or id )

Genders were introduced in Generation II for the purposes of breeding Pokémon but can also result in visual differences or even different evolutionary lines. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Gender) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#genders).

resources.name: List Genders
resources.description:

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

resources.description:

resources.name: Growth Rate by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.growthRate }}/( name or id )

Genders were introduced in Generation II for the purposes of breeding Pokémon but can also result in visual differences or even different evolutionary lines. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Experience) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#growth-rates).

resources.name: Nature by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.nature }}/( name or id )

A Pokémon's Nature usually affects the value of two of its stats, ultimately increasing one of its non-HP stats (Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, or Speed) by 10% and decreasing another by 10%.
Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#natures).

resources.name: List Natures
resources.description:
> {{ _.nature }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text
offset: The first Nature that you will get.
limit: How many Natures per page
```

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Pokeathlo Stat by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokeathlonStat }}/( name or id )

Pokeathlon Stats are different attributes of a Pokémon's performance in Pokéathlons. In Pokéathlons, competitions happen on different courses; one for each of the different Pokéathlon stats. Check out [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Pok%C3%A9athlon) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pokeathlon-stats).

resources.name: List Pokeathlon Stats
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokeathlonStat }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text

limit: How many Pokeathlon Stats per page
```

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: List Pokémons
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemon }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

```text
offset: The first Pokémon that you will get.
limit: How many Pokemons per page.
```

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Pokémon by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemon }}/(*name or id*)

Pokémon are the creatures that inhabit the world of the Pokémon games. They can be caught using Pokéballs and trained by battling with other Pokémon. Each Pokémon belongs to a specific species but may take on a variant which makes it differ from other Pokémon of the same species, such as base stats, available abilities and typings. See [Bulbapedia](https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_(species) for greater detail.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pokemon).

resources.name: Pokemon Location Area by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemon }}/( name or id )/encounters

Pokémon Location Areas are ares where Pokémon can be found.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pokemon-location-areas).

resources.name: List Pokemon Colors
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonColor }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text
offset: The first Pokemon Color that you will get.
limit: How many Pokemon Colors per page
```

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Pokemon Color by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonColor }}/( name or id )

Colors used for sorting Pokémon in a Pokédex. The color listed in the Pokédex is usually the color most apparent or covering each Pokémon's body. No orange category exists; Pokémon that are primarily orange are listed as red or brown.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pokemon-colors).

resources.name: List Pokemon Forms
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonForm }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text
offset: The first Pokemon Form that you will get.
limit: How many Pokemon Forms per page
```
Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Pokemon Form by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonForm }}/( name or id )

Some Pokémon may appear in one of multiple, visually different forms. These differences are purely cosmetic. For variations within a Pokémon species, which do differ in more than just visuals, the 'Pokémon' entity is used to represent such a variety.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pokemon-forms).

resources.name: Pokemon Habitat by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonHabitat }}/( name or id )

Habitats are generally different terrain Pokémon can be found in but can also be areas designated for rare or legendary Pokémon.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pokemon-habitats).

resources.name: List Pokemon Habitats
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonHabitat }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. ```

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Pokemon Shape by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonShape }}/( name or id )

Shapes used for sorting Pokémon in a Pokédex.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pokemon-shapes).

resources.name: List Pokemon Shapes
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonShape }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. resources.name: Pokemon Species by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonSpecies }}/( name or id )

A Pokémon Species forms the basis for at least one Pokémon. Attributes of a Pokémon species are shared across all varieties of Pokémon within the species. A good example is Wormadam; Wormadam is the species which can be found in three different varieties, Wormadam-Trash, Wormadam-Sandy and Wormadam-Plant.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#pokemon-species).

resources.name: List Pokemon Species
resources.description:
> {{ _.pokemonSpecies }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text
offset: The first Pokemon Species that you will get.
limit: How many Pokemon Species per page
```
Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Stat by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.stat }}/( name or id )

Stats determine certain aspects of battles. Each Pokémon has a value for each stat which grows as they gain levels and can be altered momentarily by effects in battles.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#stats).

resources.name: List Stats
resources.description:
> {{ _.stat }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text
offset: The first Stat that you will get.
limit: How many Stats per page
```
Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).

resources.name: Type by Name / ID
resources.description:
> {{ _.type }}/( name or id )

Types are properties for Pokémon and their moves. Each type has three properties: which types of Pokémon it is super effective against, which types of Pokémon it is not very effective against, and which types of Pokémon it is completely ineffective against.

Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#types).

resources.name: List Types
resources.description:
> {{ _.type }}/?offset=0&limit=20

Calling any API endpoint without a resource ID or name will return a paginated list of available resources for that API. By default, a list "page" will contain up to 20 resources. If you would like to change this just add a 'limit' query parameter to the GET request, e.g. ?=60. You can use 'offset' to move to the next page, e.g. ?limit=60&offset=60.

Basically:

```text

limit: How many Types per page
```
Check out the [PokéAPI Documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2#resource-listspagination-section).
